description: Turks are a gunpowder-focused civilization that excels in late-game and artillery units.
dark_age: Start with 3 villagers, a scout, and a gold miner.
Build a house, a barracks, and a lumber camp near forests.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 13-14 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 600-800 food, 100-150 wood, and 200-250 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 5-6 villagers to food, 2-3 to wood, and 2-3 to gold.
feudal_age: Build a second lumber camp and start producing archers from the range.
Build a market and blacksmith to sell excess resources for gold and upgrade archers.
Advance to Castle Age at around 21-22 minutes with 800 food and 200 gold.
Have around 1200-1500 food, 400-500 wood, 600-800 gold, and 200-300 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 10-12 villagers to food, 4-5 to wood, 4-5 to gold, and 3-4 to stone.
castle_age: Build a castle and start producing gunpowder units such as Janissaries and Bombard Cannons.
Research Chemistry, Ballistics, and Murder Holes to improve the effectiveness of gunpowder units and castle defense.
Build a university and research Masonry and Architecture to improve castle and building HP.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 29-30 minutes with 1000 food and 800 gold.
Have around 3000-3500 food, 1500-2000 wood, 2500-3000 gold, and 500-700 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 25-30 villagers to food, 12-15 to wood, 16-20 to gold, and 5-7 to stone.
imperial_age: Continue producing gunpowder units and research Elite Janissary upgrade.
Use Bombard Cannons to destroy buildings and enemy siege units.
Have around 5000-6000 food, 3000-4000 wood, and 4000-5000 gold in the late Imperial Age.
Assign 40-50 villagers to food, 20-25 to wood, 30-35 to gold, and 10-12 to stone.
